apis.description: Retrieve the list of users associated with this account.

operations.notes: Retrieve the list of users associated with this account.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list. Must be at least 3 characters.

apis.description:
Returns the current user's global activity stream, paginated.

There are many types of objects that can be returned in the activity
stream. All object types have the same basic set of shared attributes:
  !!!javascript
  {
    'created_at': '2011-07-13T09:12:00Z',
    'updated_at': '2011-07-25T08:52:41Z',
    'id': 1234,
    'title': 'Stream Item Subject',
    'message': 'This is the body text of the activity stream item. It is plain-text, and can be multiple paragraphs.',
    'type': 'DiscussionTopic|Conversation|Message|Submission|Conference|Collaboration|...',
    'read_state': false,
    'context_type': 'course', // course|group
    'course_id': 1,
    'group_id': null,
    'html_url': "http://..." // URL to the Canvas web UI for this stream item
  }

In addition, each item type has its own set of attributes available.

DiscussionTopic:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'DiscussionTopic',
    'discussion_topic_id': 1234,
    'total_root_discussion_entries': 5,
    'require_initial_post': true,
    'user_has_posted': true,
    'root_discussion_entries': {
      ...
    }
  }

For DiscussionTopic, the message is truncated at 4kb.

Announcement:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'Announcement',
    'announcement_id': 1234,
    'total_root_discussion_entries': 5,
    'require_initial_post': true,
    'user_has_posted': null,
    'root_discussion_entries': {
      ...
    }
  }

For Announcement, the message is truncated at 4kb.

Conversation:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'Conversation',
    'conversation_id': 1234,
    'private': false,
    'participant_count': 3,
  }

Message:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'Message',
    'message_id': 1234,
    'notification_category': 'Assignment Graded'
  }

Submission:

Returns an {api:Submissions:Submission Submission} with its Course and Assignment data.

Conference:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'Conference',
    'web_conference_id': 1234
  }

Collaboration:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'Collaboration',
    'collaboration_id': 1234
  }

CollectionItem:

  !!!javascript
  {
    'type': 'CollectionItem',
    'collection_item' { ... full CollectionItem data ... }
  }

apis.description: Returns a summary of the current user's global activity stream.

operations.notes: Returns a summary of the current user's global activity stream.

apis.description:
Returns the current user's list of todo items, as seen on the user dashboard.

There is a limit to the number of items returned.

The `ignore` and `ignore_permanently` URLs can be used to update the user's
preferences on what items will be displayed.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore` URL will hide that item
from future todo item requests, until the item changes.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore_permanently` URL will hide
that item forever.

operations.notes:
Returns the current user's list of todo items, as seen on the user dashboard.

There is a limit to the number of items returned.

The `ignore` and `ignore_permanently` URLs can be used to update the user's
preferences on what items will be displayed.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore` URL will hide that item
from future todo item requests, until the item changes.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore_permanently` URL will hide
that item forever.

apis.description:
Returns the current user's upcoming events, i.e. the same things shown
in the dashboard 'Coming Up' sidebar.

operations.notes:
Returns the current user's upcoming events, i.e. the same things shown
in the dashboard 'Coming Up' sidebar.

operations.notes: Hide the given stream item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description: Hide all stream items for the user

operations.notes: Hide all stream items for the user

apis.description:
Upload a file to the user's personal files section.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a user's files.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Note that typically users will only be able to upload files to their
own files section. Passing a user_id of +self+ is an easy shortcut
to specify the current user.

operations.notes:
Upload a file to the user's personal files section.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a user's files.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Note that typically users will only be able to upload files to their
own files section. Passing a user_id of +self+ is an easy shortcut
to specify the current user.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Create and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.

If you don't have the "Modify login details for users" permission, but
self-registration is enabled on the account, you can still use this
endpoint to register new users. Certain fields will be required, and
others will be ignored (see below).

operations.notes:
Create and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.

If you don't have the "Modify login details for users" permission, but
self-registration is enabled on the account, you can still use this
endpoint to register new users. Certain fields will be required, and
others will be ignored (see below).

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: user[name]
parameters.description: The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading. Required if this is a self-registration.

parameters.name: user[short_name]
parameters.description: User's name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, and comments.

parameters.name: user[sortable_name]
parameters.description: User's name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.

parameters.name: user[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones are {http://www.iana.org/time-zones IANA time zones} or friendlier {http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html Ruby on Rails time zones}.

parameters.name: user[locale]
parameters.description: The user's preferred language as a two-letter ISO 639-1 code.

parameters.name: user[birthdate]
parameters.description: The user's birth date.

parameters.name: user[terms_of_use]
parameters.description: Whether the user accepts the terms of use. Required if this is a self-registration and this canvas instance requires users to accept the terms (on by default).

parameters.name: pseudonym[unique_id]
parameters.description: User's login ID. If this is a self-registration, it must be a valid email address.

parameters.name: pseudonym[password]
parameters.description: User's password. Cannot be set during self-registration.

parameters.name: pseudonym[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: SIS ID for the user's account. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions.

parameters.name: pseudonym[send_confirmation]
parameters.description: Send user notification of account creation if true. Automatically set to true during self-registration.

parameters.name: communication_channel[type]
parameters.description: The communication channel type, e.g. 'email' or 'sms'.

parameters.name: communication_channel[address]
parameters.description: The communication channel address, e.g. the user's email address.

apis.description: Update an existing user's settings.

operations.notes: Update an existing user's settings.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: manual_mark_as_read
parameters.description: If true, require user to manually mark discussion posts as read (don't auto-mark as read).

apis.description: Update an existing user's settings.

operations.notes: Update an existing user's settings.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: manual_mark_as_read
parameters.description: If true, require user to manually mark discussion posts as read (don't auto-mark as read).

apis.description: Modify an existing user. To modify a user's login, see the documentation for logins.

operations.notes: Modify an existing user. To modify a user's login, see the documentation for logins.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: user[name]
parameters.description: The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading.

parameters.name: user[short_name]
parameters.description: User's name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, and comments.

parameters.name: user[sortable_name]
parameters.description: User's name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.

parameters.name: user[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones are {http://www.iana.org/time-zones IANA time zones} or friendlier {http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html Ruby on Rails time zones}.

parameters.name: user[locale]
parameters.description: The user's preferred language as a two-letter ISO 639-1 code.

parameters.name: user[avatar][token]
parameters.description: A unique representation of the avatar record to assign as the user's current avatar. This token can be obtained from the user avatars endpoint. This supersedes the user[avatar][url] argument, and if both are included the url will be ignored. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

parameters.name: user[avatar][url]
parameters.description: To set the user's avatar to point to an external url, do not include a token and instead pass the url here. Warning: For maximum compatibility, please use 128 px square images.

apis.description:
Delete a user record from Canvas.

WARNING: This API will allow a user to delete themselves. If you do this,
you won't be able to make API calls or log into Canvas.

operations.notes:
Delete a user record from Canvas.

WARNING: This API will allow a user to delete themselves. If you do this,
you won't be able to make API calls or log into Canvas.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Follow this user. If the current user is already following the
target user, nothing happens. The target user must have a public profile in
order to follow it.

On success, returns the User object. Responds with a 401 if the user
doesn't have permission to follow the target user, or a 400 if the user
can't follow the target user (if the user and target user are the same, for
example).

operations.notes:
Follow this user. If the current user is already following the
target user, nothing happens. The target user must have a public profile in
order to follow it.

On success, returns the User object. Responds with a 401 if the user
doesn't have permission to follow the target user, or a 400 if the user
can't follow the target user (if the user and target user are the same, for
example).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Stop following this user. If the current user is not already following the
target user, nothing happens.

operations.notes:
Stop following this user. If the current user is not already following the
target user, nothing happens.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Merge a user into another user.
To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users.

When finding users by SIS ids in different accounts the
destination_account_id is required.

The account can also be identified by passing the domain in destination_account_id.

operations.notes:
Merge a user into another user.
To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users.

When finding users by SIS ids in different accounts the
destination_account_id is required.

The account can also be identified by passing the domain in destination_account_id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: destination_user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Returns user profile data, including user id, name, and profile pic.

When requesting the profile for the user accessing the API, the user's
calendar feed URL will be returned as well.

operations.notes:
Returns user profile data, including user id, name, and profile pic.

When requesting the profile for the user accessing the API, the user's
calendar feed URL will be returned as well.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Retrieve the possible user avatar options that can be set with the user update endpoint. The response will be an array of avatar records. If the 'type' field is 'attachment', the record will include all the normal attachment json fields; otherwise it will include only the 'url' and 'display_name' fields. Additionally, all records will include a 'type' field and a 'token' field. The following explains each field in more detail
type:: ["gravatar"|"attachment"|"no_pic"] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.
url:: The url of the avatar 
token:: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.
display_name:: A textual description of the avatar record
id:: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment
content-type:: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment
filename:: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment
size:: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

operations.notes:
Retrieve the possible user avatar options that can be set with the user update endpoint. The response will be an array of avatar records. If the 'type' field is 'attachment', the record will include all the normal attachment json fields; otherwise it will include only the 'url' and 'display_name' fields. Additionally, all records will include a 'type' field and a 'token' field. The following explains each field in more detail
type:: ["gravatar"|"attachment"|"no_pic"] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.
url:: The url of the avatar 
token:: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.
display_name:: A textual description of the avatar record
id:: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment
content-type:: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment
filename:: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment
size:: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Return the user's page view history in json format, similar to the
available CSV download. Pagination is used as described in API basics
section. Page views are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

operations.notes:
Return the user's page view history in json format, similar to the
available CSV download. Pagination is used as described in API basics
section. Page views are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the time range from which you want page views.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the time range from which you want page views.

User.description: A Canvas user, e.g. a student, teacher, administrator, observer, etc.

sortable_name.description: The name of the user that is should be used for sorting groups of users, such as in the gradebook.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import.

sis_login_id.description: DEPRECATED: The SIS login ID associated with the user. Please use the sis_user_id or login_id. This field will be removed in a future version of the API.

login_id.description: The unique login id for the user.  This is what the user uses to log in to Canvas.

avatar_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

enrollments.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return a list of the users active enrollments. See the List enrollments API for more details about the format of these records.

email.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users primary email address.

locale.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users locale.

last_login.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return a timestamp representing the last time the user logged in to canvas.

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in ceratin API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

Profile.description: Profile details for a Canvas user.

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

type.description: ['gravatar'|'attachment'|'no_pic'] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.

token.description: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

display_name.description: A textual description of the avatar record.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

content-type.description: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment.

filename.description: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment

size.description: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

PageView.description: The record of a user page view access in Canvas

id.description: A UUID representing the page view.  This is also the unique request id

context_type.description: The type of context for the request

asset_type.description: The type of asset in the context for the request, if any

controller.description: The rails controller that handled the request

action.description: The rails action that handled the request

contributed.description: True if the request counted as contributing, such as editing a wiki page

interaction_seconds.description: An approximation of how long the user spent on the page, in seconds

user_request.description: A flag indicating whether the request was user-initiated, or automatic (such as an AJAX call)

render_time.description: How long the response took to render, in seconds

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the browser or program that made the request
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/536.30.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/6.0.5 Safari/536.30.1

participated.description: True if the request counted as participating, such as submitting homework

http_method.description: The HTTP method such as GET or POST

remote_ip.description: The origin IP address of the request

links.description: The page view links to define the relationships

PageViewLinks.description: The links of a page view access in Canvas

user.description: The ID of the user for this page view

context.description: The ID of the context for the request (course id if context_type is Course, etc)

asset.description: The ID of the asset for the request, if any

real_user.description: The ID of the actual user who made this request, if the request was made by a user who was masquerading

account.description: The ID of the account context for this page view
